PM Christopher Luxon and Nicole McKee to announce justice changes, Government brings back Three Strikes law https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/watch-live-government-to-announce-justice-changes/EVNFQ354KJC5DA46R2YS2523JM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/watch-live-government-to-announce-justice-changes/EVNFQ354KJC5DA46R2YS2523JM/ Reinstating Three Strikes was a policy campaigned on at the election. Mon, 22 Apr 2024 01:15:58 +0000 Prime Minister Christopher Luxon and Associate Justice Minister Nicole McKee have unveiled a revised Three Strikes law, which was abolished under the Labour Government. Photo / Mark Mitchell
Air New Zealand flights to Australia and Pacific receive new fare systemhttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/travel/air-new-zealand-flights-to-australia-and-pacific-receive-new-fare-system/6UZWZH2MJBF5ZJCLDINUN43MXE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/travel/air-new-zealand-flights-to-australia-and-pacific-receive-new-fare-system/6UZWZH2MJBF5ZJCLDINUN43MXE/ Sarah PollokThe changes will come into play from June 11. Sun, 21 Apr 2024 22:50:00 +0000 Air New Zealand has introduced several changes to fare types. Photo / Greg Bowker
Audrey Young: Crown challenge to Waitangi Tribunal summons of Karen Chhour set to be heard today https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/crown-challenge-to-waitangi-tribunal-summons-of-karen-chhour-set-to-be-heard-today/DDZ6BTTA5ND7ZN7FKSTFSQH5UI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/crown-challenge-to-waitangi-tribunal-summons-of-karen-chhour-set-to-be-heard-today/DDZ6BTTA5ND7ZN7FKSTFSQH5UI/ Audrey YoungOPINION: Crown Law has pulled out its big guns to challenge the Tribunal summons. Sun, 21 Apr 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Key players (top from left: minister Karen Chhour, Judge Michael Doogan, NZ First's Shane Jones and Act leader David Seymour. Justice Andru Isac (bottom from left), Solicitor-General Una Jagose, Crown counsel Jason Varuhas and barrister Matanuku Mahuika. Photos / NZME
Public sector cuts: Customs and the Department of Internal Affairs propose further job losses https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/public-sector-cuts-customs-begins-consultation-with-staff-on-further-cuts/TDHHUY7J2VEQ3MOTOEDYHPO6JQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/public-sector-cuts-customs-begins-consultation-with-staff-on-further-cuts/TDHHUY7J2VEQ3MOTOEDYHPO6JQ/ Azaria HowellThe PSA says jobs would be cut from airports and counter terrorism teams. Mon, 22 Apr 2024 02:00:00 +0000 The New Zealand Customs Service has been asked to find cost savings of 6.5 per cent. Photo / Mark Mitchell
Recession hits, thousands join unemployment queue - but still vacancies https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/recession-hits-jobs-market-as-thousands-join-unemployment-queue/ICDZ3LACIFBWTMSWAUMKLIMZOQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/recession-hits-jobs-market-as-thousands-join-unemployment-queue/ICDZ3LACIFBWTMSWAUMKLIMZOQ/ Carmen HallMeet the employers who can't get workers despite the recession. Sun, 21 Apr 2024 20:36:00 +0000 There are more job applicants now in comparison to a year ago. Photo / 123rf
Body found in Wellington Harbour: No clues yet to identity of woman https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/body-found-in-wellington-harbour-no-clues-yet-to-identity-of-woman/X7H66LUGDJGAZOXNEQHX3MCHJM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/body-found-in-wellington-harbour-no-clues-yet-to-identity-of-woman/X7H66LUGDJGAZOXNEQHX3MCHJM/ Melissa NightingaleMultiple people have died in Wellington Harbour during the past decade. Wētā Digital deal ‘bananas’: How Sir Peter Jackson got to have his billion-dollar exit cake and eat Hollywood too https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/how-sir-peter-jackson-got-to-have-his-billion-dollar-exit-cake-and-eat-hollywood-too/VIRUIP3P6RDJ3AM2PXOFOUISHQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/how-sir-peter-jackson-got-to-have-his-billion-dollar-exit-cake-and-eat-hollywood-too/VIRUIP3P6RDJ3AM2PXOFOUISHQ/ Matt NippertThe collapse of a $2.2b deal for VFX software leaves Wellywood more powerful than ever. Sun, 21 Apr 2024 17:00:00 +0000 The wash-up of the $2.2b purchase by Unity Technologies of Wētā Digital software, used to produce effects for The Hobbit, sees only one side of the transaction covered in gold.
David Beckham files lawsuit against Mark Wahlberg for $17.8 million over F45 deal https://www.nzherald.co.nz/entertainment/david-beckham-files-lawsuit-against-mark-wahlberg-for-178-million-over-f45-deal/OC535UCYZRE75MTCDRVR4PR5KY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/entertainment/david-beckham-files-lawsuit-against-mark-wahlberg-for-178-million-over-f45-deal/OC535UCYZRE75MTCDRVR4PR5KY/ The football ace has launched a multimillion-dollar lawsuit after an F45 deal went sour. Sun, 21 Apr 2024 21:04:10 +0000 Football star David Beckham has launched a multimillion-dollar lawsuit against Hollywood actor Mark Wahlberg after a deal went sour. Photos / Getty Images
Dilworth abuser got away at 1978 meeting, allowing more boys to be hurt, two former students say https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/dilworth-abuser-got-away-at-1978-meeting-allowing-more-boys-to-be-hurt-two-former-students-say/AFP7JZT3PVF7RK3YGCJNDTTKZY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/dilworth-abuser-got-away-at-1978-meeting-allowing-more-boys-to-be-hurt-two-former-students-say/AFP7JZT3PVF7RK3YGCJNDTTKZY/ John Weekes'It set a precedent - that if you get caught, you were just allowed to leave.' Sun, 21 Apr 2024 22:12:21 +0000 A former Dilworth Trust Board chair has defended the handling of a 1978 meeting with a staff member who admitted inappropriately touching boys. The board did not report the staff member to police. Photo / NZME
Woolworths roll out body cameras for supermarket staff as assaults, abuse skyrockets https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/45m-security-spend-woolworths-roll-out-body-cameras-for-staff-as-assaults-abuse-skyrockets/5SIOOXDFP5GC3JAWPHDKXEL3BA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/45m-security-spend-woolworths-roll-out-body-cameras-for-staff-as-assaults-abuse-skyrockets/5SIOOXDFP5GC3JAWPHDKXEL3BA/ The rollout is part of Woolworths’ three year, $45 million programme to add more security. Mon, 22 Apr 2024 00:43:47 +0000 Woolworths is introducing team safety cameras in its 191 stores this week, following positive feedback from a trial in 17 supermarkets. Photo / Supplied
